title: Magnetism - bar magnet split in half

content.question: A bar magnet is placed on a table with the north pole facing right and the south pole facing left. A short time later, the bar is cut in half and each piece is separated so that there is a gap between the two pieces as shown. A magnetic compass is placed directly between the two pieces. Which of the following best describes the direction the compass needle will point and provides correct justification?

choices.label: Toward the left because the end with the south pole of the original bar magnet is to the left of the compass.
Toward the left because a south pole will be established on near end of the piece of bar magnet immediately to the left of the compass.
Toward the right because a south pole will be established on the near end of the piece of bar magnet immediately to the right of the compass.
Toward the right because the end with the north pole of the original bar magnet is to the right of the compass.

content.answer: Toward the right because a south pole will be established on the near end of the piece of bar magnet immediately to the right of the compass.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
